main event: A pilot observed an unidentified flying object with an irregular flight path over Bitburg, Germany on January 30, 1958.
interesting points: The object had a size comparable to a dime at arm's length., The colors of the object were red, greenish yellow, and slightly blue., The sighting lasted for approximately three minutes., The object's flight path was jagged and included side-to-side motion., There is a possibility that the object could be a balloon or helicopter.
witness description: 1st Lt James E. Briggs, Pilot, 22nd Fighter Day Squadron
